Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Dear all, We received the link to the evaluation for this year's course of Flight Mechanics 2. We kindly ask you to take a few minutes to answer the questions. The evaluation is open until the 15th July.  Evaluation link: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=S9G8L Thank you and have a nice week, Sven

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Hello everybody. We will offer the third simulator session this week. You will find a poll here where you can choose a slot.  See you in the simulator session, Sven

Messages.Author: Pedro Jose Gonzalez Ramirez
Messages.Content: Dear Students,  As we told you last week, we are at the IFASD-2024. The department is presenting six papers at this conference. I will share them later with you.  The videos and slides corresponding to this week's lecture are available in ISIS. Please watch them, next week I will take care of the respective exercise and Prof. Silvestre will do a summary and revision of this lecture before continuing with the lateral motion. Please, feel free to come with questions and doubts during next week's office hours.  Regards from The Hague Pedro

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Hello everybody. We will offer the second out of four simulator session this week. You will find a poll here where you can choose a slot.  See you in the simulator session, Sven

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Talk on flight testing and certification

Messages.Author: Pedro Jose Gonzalez Ramirez
Messages.Content: Dear students,  tomorrow at 14,15 in the PC pool our colleague Leandro Bigarella (Lead Flight Test Engineer at EASA) will participate in the AFF course. He is going to give a presentation regarding flight testing and certification. I think it will be interesting for you to participate in this class. Feel free to come by.  Regards Pedro

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Hello everybody, due to many request, you have until Thursday (13th June) 11:59 pm time to complete homework 4.  Regards Sven

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Hello everybody. We will offer the first out of four simulator session this week. You will find a poll here where you can choose a slot. The sessions are optional. The session this week will practical teach you how to trimm an aircraft.  See you in the simulator session, Sven

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Wegbeschreibung zum SEPHIR:  Der Flugsimulator SEPHIR befindet sich im Erdgeschoss des F-Gebäudes im Raum F 19/20. Über den Haupteingang nehmt ihr einfach die Tür hinter der Pförtnerloge und folgt dem linken Gang um ein paar Ecken bis zum Ende. Die Tür zum SEPHIR befindet sich dann rechts. Falls ihr den Eingang zum F11 nehmt, müsst ihr rechts den Gang runter und durch die Tür am Ende des Gangs durch. Dann befindet ihr euch direkt vor der Tür zum SEPHIR.

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Hello everyone, Due to a mistake you have two weeks (until 12th of June) for homework 3.  However we will upload homework 4 today so you have to do both homework's until the 12th of June.   Regards Sven

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Hello. Everybody who has registered for the exam should have received an email with the assigned student number for the homework's.  Please make sure to use the values with your student number. You will find the values for the second homework in the student values folder.  Due to request of students, we have change the homework's deadline to Wednesdays 12:00 p.m.    If you have questions, feel free to ask. Best wishes, Sven

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Dear Students. The first homework will start this Wednesday.  For the following homework's please make sure to use the provided solution template. After the registration is over, each of you will be given a homework number. Please make sure to rename the solution template with your number, for example: solution XX.txt -> solution 13.txt Please also make sure to not change anything in the file except the value. For commas please use dots. If you do not have an answer for one or more asked values please delete the X.XXX and set it to 0.000 as below shown.  symbol     unit   value CL                 [1] = 0.000 xAC_w             [m] = 0.000  If you have any questions don't hesitate to send me an email.   Regards  Sven

Messages.Author: Pedro Jose Gonzalez Ramirez
Messages.Content: Dear Students,  finally, the course is available in MTS. Now you can go and register so you can do the homework. Please let me know if you have any troubles with the registration process. Have fun with the assignments.  Regards Pedro

Messages.Author: Sven Markus Zabel
Messages.Content: Hello everybody,  Please make sure to register ASAP for the exam because we will close the registration on this Sunday (19th of May). Everybody will be able to do the first homework. For the second and following homework's only those who have registered will be able to complete these homework's.  Regards  Sven

Messages.Author: Pedro Jose Gonzalez Ramirez
Messages.Content: Dear Students,  as promised, I just uploaded the slides from today. I finished the derivation for q_dot, Theta_dot, X_dot and H_dot. Please, take a look at the procedure and if you have any doubts we can discuss them during consultation hours or the next tutorial.  Best, Pedro

Messages.Author: Pedro Jose Gonzalez Ramirez
Messages.Content: Dear Students, I am writing you to remind you that the Exercise of FM2 is on Thursdays at 10:15 in the PC-Pool (F326). We are excited to start a new semester. Hope to see you tomorrow.  Kind regards Pedro

Discussions.Discussion_Name: New HiWi Position in FlexFuture Project

Messages.Author: Pedro Jose Gonzalez Ramirez
Messages.Content: Dear Students   we have a new student position in the FlexFuture project.   https://www.tu.berlin/en/fmra/research/projects/flexfuture  It is focused on the design and construction of the fuselage of the airplane and in the preparation of the next set of wind tunnel tests. Here are the links to the position.  https://www.jobs.tu-berlin.de/stellenausschreibungen/181741  https://tub.stellenticket.de/de/offers/181741/  Kind regards   Pedro

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Abschlussarbeiten am Fachgebiet Flugmechanik, Flugreglung & Aeroelastizität

Messages.Author: Pedro Jose Gonzalez Ramirez
Messages.Content: Liebe Studierende, das Fachgebiet für Flugmechanik, Flugreglung & Aeroelastizität möchte den Start des neuen Semesters als Anlass nehmen, um interessierte Studierenden, die aktuell auf der Suche nach einem Thema für eine Abschlussarbeit sind, über mögliche Arbeiten an unserem Fachgebiet zu informieren. Dazu bieten wir folgende Veranstaltung an:   Informationsveranstaltung für Abschlussarbeiten am Fachgebiet Flugmechanik, Flugreglung & Aeroelastizität  Montag, 22.04.2024 12 – 14 Uhr F224  Es handelt sich um eine Präsenzveranstaltung. Die wissenschaftlichen Mitarbeiter werden die angebotenen Themen kurz vorstellen. Im Anschluss habt ihr die Möglichkeit, mit den potentiellen Betreuern ins persönliche Gespräch zu kommen und dabei Fragen zu klären oder Anregungen einzuholen.  Solltet Ihr bis dahin bereits Fragen haben, so könnt ihr gerne Hannes Wilke (h.wilke[at]tu-berlin.de) kontaktieren.  ___________________________________________________________________________  Dear students,  The Chair for flight mechanics, flight control, and aeroelasticity would like to take the start of the new semester as an opportunity to inform interested students, who are currently looking for a thesis topic, about possible theses at our department. Therefore, we are offering the following event:   Information event for final theses at the Department of Flight Mechanics, Flight Control & Aeroelasticity Monday, 22.04.2024 12 - 14 o'clock F224  This event is in person. The research assistants will briefly present each topic on offer. Afterward, you will have the chance to talk to the potential supervisors in person and ask questions or get suggestions.  If you have any questions by then, please feel free to contact Hannes Wilke (h.wilke[at]tu-berlin.de).
